gmd:fileIdentifier.gco:CharacterString: CanSISE Observation-Based Ensemble of Northern Hemisphere Terrestrial Snow Water Equivalent V001

gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: CanSISE Observation-Based Ensemble of Northern Hemisphere Terrestrial Snow Water Equivalent

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: CanSISE Observation-Based Ensemble of Northern Hemisphere Terrestrial Snow Water Equivalent V001

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Snow and Ice Data Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
This data set is a daily gridded terrestrial snow water equivalent (SWE) dataset based on five component SWE products:
  • GlobSnow combined SWE product (passive mircowave/ground-based weather station, version 2)
  • ERA-Interim/Land reanalysis SWE product
  • MERRA reanalysis SWE product
  • Crocus SWE data set: output from the Crocus snowpack model, driven by ERA-Interim meteorology (Brun et al. 2013)
  • GLDAS SWE product (version 2) (Rodell et al. 2004; Rodell and Beaudoing 2013)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: NASA EOS provides global passive microwave measurements of the Earth

The Nimbus-7 spacecraft was the last in a series of operational weather satellites operated by the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
